intro: Dicalix costatus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in disturbed habitats such as along roadsides or in cultivated fields. Dicalix costatus is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton.
